page.title: 17BEXHILL HOSPITAL AND HEALTH
page.content: The hospital was built in{1932}by contributions from{Bexhill citizens who saved "a mile of pennies" or who bought a family brick for the cost of a penny. It is situated near{Old Town. When it opened it catered for all aspects of medicine and surgery, as well as{emergencies,}but today the latter{must go over to Hastings}and there is{no}longer a{maternity unit, although there is an{Out Patients {Department}for all ages. Much of the hospital is now used for the{general care of the elderly, who form a large part of our population. A special{Day Hospital Unit was added in 1974 to help with the increasing numbers of weekly therapy and rehabilitation cases.{GPs are{responsible for patients}in the medical wards. Admissions are often made to{relieve families}for a while.
